title: Swapping blemished for sound animal
vignette: A farmer pledges an unblemished lamb but then substitutes a blemished one instead.

options.text: Reject the substitution and keep the original holy.
Allow the swap since both belong to him.

title: Regretting a substitution vow
vignette: After declaring a substitute, the owner immediately regrets it and wants to rescind.

options.text: Too late—the substitution stands.
Permit annulment due to hasty speech.

title: senior professional uses substitute for private feast
vignette: A senior professional exchanges a central complex ram for a similar one and keeps the first for himself at a party.

options.text: He must return it and bring an offering for misuse.
No harm if equal value remains dedicated.

title: Second substitution attempt
vignette: Someone already swapped one animal and now tries to substitute again for the new one.

options.text: Only the first exchange takes effect.
Each swap works creating multiple sacred animals.

title: Minor declaring a substitution
vignette: A child tending the flock pronounces a substitute on his father's offering.

options.text: It is void because he lacks authority.
Count it since he spoke sincerely.

title: Substituting for communal sacrifice
vignette: Members of a town attempt to exchange their communal offering for a nicer one.

options.text: Communal offerings cannot be swapped.
Allow it to enhance the sacrifice.

title: Exchange for a donation animal
vignette: A donor wants to substitute his pledged bull for another he later purchased.

options.text: The new bull also becomes holy in addition to the first.
Only the replacement becomes dedicated.

title: Double substitution confusion
vignette: Two people mistakenly substitute animals for each other’s offerings.

options.text: Both exchanges create extra sacred animals.
Cancel the swaps to avoid chaos.

title: Offspring of a substitute
vignette: A calf born from a substituted cow raises the question of holiness.

options.text: The offspring is also sacred.
Only the mother retains holiness.

title: Substituting female for male Passover lamb
vignette: Before Passover the owner swaps his male lamb for a healthy ewe.

options.text: Invalid swap; keep the male for sacrifice.
Accept the ewe to fulfill the offering.

title: Mumbled substitution declaration
vignette: The owner speaks unclearly when declaring a substitution, leaving witnesses unsure.

options.text: Without clarity it has no effect.
Assume intent and apply the substitution.

title: Non-Jew attempting substitution
vignette: A visiting outsider offers to substitute his animal for a Jew's offering.

options.text: Disallow; substitution applies only to Israelites.
Permit if the owner agrees.

title: Substitution with intent to sell
vignette: The owner swaps a better animal intending to sell the original for profit.

options.text: Both animals remain holy and cannot be sold freely.
Allow sale of one to fund the central complex.

title: Different species substitution
vignette: A goat is switched for an ox dedicated earlier.

options.text: The goat also becomes holy alongside the ox.
Substitution fails because species differ.

title: Substitute discovered post-sacrifice
vignette: Only after slaughtering the substitute does the owner realize his error.

options.text: The offering counts though improper.
It is invalid; a new sacrifice is needed.
